website_summaries.verdict: While it looks like it came from the future, the Zeiss Cinemizer OLED headset offers performance from the Dark Ages.
pros: The Zeiss Cinemizer OLED is a lightweight and portable 3D headset with very good battery life
The headset is stylish and appears well-made
cons: Image quality is poor, plagued by blue and red crosstalk and minimal shadow detail, draining images of impact
The 40-inch simulated image is way too small
The earbuds sound terrible, and the headphone jack only works with the iPhone attachment
They also make you look weird

customer_reviews.title: Lack of physically adjustable features, could not get clear and sharp images for both eyes
customer_reviews.text: I wish the distance between the 2 small OLED screens were adjustable. I could only get one of the screen look sharp because the other screen would be slightly off for my other eye. If I pushed both screens a few millimeters further both would look sharp, but I would need to use a hand to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: GadgSmart

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment for production work.
customer_reviews.text: I do production work with editing software and these goggles don't show the detail needed for my work. I was expecting an amazing view from zeiss OLED but was totally disappointing. Even videos aren't smooth. I don't know why they are priced so high either, for what I can see on the screen, the Avegant Glyph perform better and are almost half price.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Screen size small
customer_reviews.text: Nothing prevents outside light from getting in. The screen size looked like you were holding an smart phone about a foot from your face. Not worth that much money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Maurizio

customer_reviews.title: they aren't the best as a replacement monitor for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Video quality is stellar, but don't buy these thinking you'll use them on your computer all day. Due to the low resolution, they aren't the best as a replacement monitor for everyday use. However, for professionals looking for a field video monitor, or the privacy-minded traveler who wants to avoid prying eyes while working on sensitive files or watching movies in public places, these are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: CassClay

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Fun
customer_reviews.text: You need a mini HDMI cord to connect to your DJI Drone but what a trip it is like you are flying.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Low screen quality and small screen...do not recommend it at this price point...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and sony hmz-t3 for dji phantom vision 2plus....This is light weight and easier to use and carry and adjust if you compare with sony but screen size is really small and surrounding of the screen is blue...for this price i would expect bigger screen size and at least hd quality. Sony's screen size was nice and picture quality was way better then zeiss but you have to spend a lot of time to adjust everything and it is really bulky. So if you are looking for fpv goggles then i would recommend you to wait for better options. Returned both and waiting for a better option.
customer_reviews.author: REDFOXXX

customer_reviews.title: Cinemizer did not work .
customer_reviews.text: Cinemizer is not worth money because it do not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good design, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the screen looks very small. Also, not totally in focus even after adjusting he diopter. In fact it is so small and not sharp enough that you can barely read messages on ps4 when playing a game. I have the Sony hmtz3 which is much better quality but you have to fiddle a lot to get it right. This one is easier to adjust but bad in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tontondavid

customer_reviews.title: Tiny screen
customer_reviews.text: Just received them ... Tried to watch a movie on Amazon prime on my Roku 4 player sadly the HDMI wouldn't show picture but did get the Roku Home screen but wouldn't let me see movies !!!! Tiny screen !!!!!! Tried directly to TV with the Roku 4 player & it works !!!!!!! They claimed it's 42'" @6' !!! Not !!!!! Tiny screen ,tiny print tiny screen more like 24" @ 6'can't adjust enough & really can't wear my prescription glasses ...... Have requested return !!
customer_reviews.author: Rodger B. Terrey

customer_reviews.title: If you wear glasses for reading and your wondering if ...
customer_reviews.text: If you wear glasses for reading and your wondering if these or the Head plays think no more ..This is your only choice Trust Me!
customer_reviews.author: Eloy A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Having a problem with the battery will not hold charge
customer_reviews.author: Dennis F.

customer_reviews.title: Decent at best
customer_reviews.text: Video quality is average. Battery life is nowhere near the 6 hours stated. Off a full charge your luck to get 3 hours of continuous use. They say it's like looking at a 40in screen... That's a laugh. Hopefully they serve the purpose in which I bought them...decent FPV goggles for flying my drones
customer_reviews.author: MMastro28

customer_reviews.title: Great picture. Pricey
customer_reviews.text: Great picture. Pricey. Tend to not stay on your face. If using for FPV, do search for the Cinemizer goggle mod.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rotindo

customer_reviews.title: That said picture is great, wish some would make these type of glasses ...
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed, to many parts, complicated, for the price cheaply made. That said picture is great, wish some would make these type of glasses plug and play at a cheaper price with this type of picture quality – anyone out there have any suggestion?
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: If you want towatch movies on a long
customer_reviews.text: The technology and presentation is well produced. The issue really depends on the use. If you want to watch movies on a long, international flight, then this is a good escape. I purchased it to serve as virtual eyes for my drone. These glasses have been around for a while, but display technology has moved on. The key issue is the net visual resolution. My drone feed is 720p, but the effective screen does not give enough range of vision to comfort this pilot. It has it's uses, but not mine....
customer_reviews.author: Rex W Heyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, And quick delivery. I found them very comfortable for watching movies, Videos, Etc.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: ... flying an FPV mini quad and it produces a fantastic picture when used with a suitably high quality camera
customer_reviews.text: I use these for flying an FPV mini quad and it produces a fantastic picture when used with a suitably high quality camera. The good points are the great picture quality, wide FOV, and great battery life. The overall experience has been well designed. The bad points are the lack of a strap (they are a bit heavy) and the price. I recommend the rubber eye cups for outdoor use as well.
customer_reviews.author: N. H. Nifong

customer_reviews.title: Only work once, not charging anymore
customer_reviews.text: Only work once, not charging anymore, $789.00 investment to the garbage. I live far from US, too expensive to return and 14 days passed.
customer_reviews.author: Mwayi S.

customer_reviews.title: I haven't been able to use then because of a suspect bad cable that is in transit
customer_reviews.text: So far, I haven't been able to use then because of a suspect bad cable that is in transit. Hopefully, once I have that part and if it fixes my connection to my LG G3 then I'll be much happier. It works with my wife's iPhone but that isn't what I will be using.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Argo

customer_reviews.title: Vast Improvement over VGA
customer_reviews.text: We replaced all our VGA goggles with cinimizers. They are a vast improvement in video quality and number of pixels displayed. The built in adjusting lenses work really well too. Patients don't have to wear their eye glasses when wearing these glasses. The company support has been really good too.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I have a wire to connect my iPad to auxiliar input in my TV and that's how I see my movies and shows on TV, the Cinemizer does not take, thru te auxiliar input the signal, I have to buy the iphone kit that I do not know if it fits my iPad, so that thing of the iphone is an extra unnecessary payment. The wire of cinemizer is too thick that it makes difficult to enjoy a movie as the glasses move very easily. The price is too high for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: It is an amazing experience. It makes my job very easy
customer_reviews.text: From the day I received this Cinemizer, I never do aerial filming or photography with Dji Inspire 1 without it. It is an amazing experience. It makes my job very easy. Forget about those who complain about this product, they may be having problem with their won devices. I recommend this production for aerial videographer and photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Saif Al Lamki

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. There is not $789 worth of technology in this device.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: At this price they should be 4k an eye
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a vr headset for less than $300 that is almost 4k, and has more adjustability. This thing is way overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Eakins

customer_reviews.title: product has a short life
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI port of my video glasses purchased 3 years ago at a trade convention do not work any more, all signal lost. It was overpriced at that time $1,200. I expect they last longer for this price. Pros: - supports users with prescription glasses - the handles on the both sides can bend, make them hard to break - supports 3D Cons: - pictures are not that big like screen size claim. - short life - overpriced
customer_reviews.author: Mecyoru

customer_reviews.title: Best Jordy LaForge cosplay glasses ever!
customer_reviews.text: got these to use for gaming with my retro pi. The color pop was lacking, and the headphones are not the best... BUT when my roomies went to Star Trek Trivia, i threw on my best red shirt, made a quick communicator on my 3D printer, threw on the glasses and POW best costume win! Sorry Amber, AKA girl with the spock ears, your logic failed to make you this year's costumw winner :D
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Dread

customer_reviews.title: Oled glasses, German manufacturing quality, size is right.
customer_reviews.text: Impressive, very impressive! Zeiss has come up with a solution that is nearly perfect. Wether you use it for movies at home or for drone control outside, the picture remains crystal-clear and the wieght of the glasses remains soft. And they do look good. One thing to imprive is the smart box, you need to find somewhere to hide it (sometimes in my pocket...). Definitely a strong and futuristic product. Oh and its packaging is superb, a good hint at the quality you get. Oled screen is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Paris

customer_reviews.title: Its very expensive, lots of other options out there
customer_reviews.text: Ill stick with my Ps4 pro and PlayStation VR thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Doug York

customer_reviews.title: Super suit
customer_reviews.text: Scroll to the end and he never found his super suit
customer_reviews.author: Devlin mc

customer_reviews.title: lightweight but terrible picture
customer_reviews.text: of all the hmd's on the market i had my hopes up on this one becase its so lite and fits like sunglasses, but that was the only good things about the unit, the resolution is terrible cant read any kind of text, and the screen looks like a 32" from 6' away chromatic abberation i would think would be a thing of the past for anything with the zeiss name on it, but this unit had it in droves i sent mine back asap
customer_reviews.author: joepow

product_meta.title: Cinemizer 1909-127 OLED Multimedia Video Glasses
product_meta.description: Thanks to the engineering experts at Carl Zeiss, the cinemizer OLED is "Best in Class" for wearable 3D video display technology. The cinemizer uses high resolution micro displays (870 x 500) to produce superior image quality while ensuring optimum comfort and versatility. Mobility The cinemizer OLED is designed for mobile use. The integrated rechargeable battery provides power for up to six hours of viewing enjoyment even when away from the confines of your home. For example, while on a flight, you can watch several movies from your iPhone on the cinemizer multimedia video glasses. Connection possibilities The cinemizer multimedia video glasses can be used for various applications. It can be connected to an iPod/iPhone, smartphone with HDMI or analog A/V interface, Blu-ray player, gaming consoles such as PS3 or XBox, PCs & notebooks, and other devices. This is all made possible by an HDMI adapter, a video cable (yellow cinch) and the optional iPod/iPhone adapter. Diopter adjustment Eyeglass wearers can configure their prescription from -5 to +2 diopters in each eye via the setting wheel. Rich colors OLED displays create crisp images with very vibrant colors, true black and thus very good contrast. Wearing comfort Emphasis was given to a low weight and optimal wearing comfort during development of the cinemizer OLED. The soft silicon nose pad allows the glasses to sit comfortably on your nose. The two soft rubber ear clips guarantee a good, comfortable sit, allowing you to use the cinemizer OLED for hours at a time. 3D support Various stereoscopic 3D formats are supported. These are side-by-side, top-bottom or line-interleaved such as Frame Packing via HDMI 1.4. Note: For customer service related queries you may contact the center at 1-855-969-3301, or service@cinemizer.us
feature_bullets: HDMI, Apple, AV-3.5mm 4 pin input capability
